title: MC2020 - Linear Algebra -E2022
text: Welcome to Linear Algebra!

title: MC2020 - Linear Algebra -E2022
text:
Course Overview:
This course covers matrix theory, determinants and system of linear equations, vector spaces, linear transformations, eigen values and eigen vectors and quadratic forms.

title: MC2020 - Linear Algebra -E2022
text:
Expected outcomes:
By the end of the course, the student should be able to perform operations on matrices, and classify, and simplify matrix expressions; reduce matrices to echelon forms, calculate the rank, determinants and the inverse and solve system of linear equations; work with arbitrary vector spaces and to generalize geometrical concepts on them; identify a linear transformation and represent it as a matrix and analyse and interpret it using matrix theory; calculate eigenvalues and eigenvectors, interpret their physical significance and perform diagonalization; calculate matrix exponential and understanding of Caley Hamilton theorem; to identify quadratic forms, and use them to analyse geometrical objects and determine the definiteness of a matrix.

title: MC2020 - Linear Algebra -E2022
text:
Evaluation:
The final letter grade for this course will be determined by each method of assessment weighted as follows:

In course assessments (50%)

Assignment (30%)
Mid-semester assessment (20%)

End of course examination (50%)

title: MC2020 - Linear Algebra -E2022
text:
Attendance Policy:
Regular attendance is a fundamental aspect of your success in this course. To maintain an engaged and collaborative learning environment, a minimum attendance rate of \(80\%\) is compulsory. Attendance will be recorded during each class session. If we find that your attendance percentage falls below the required threshold due to extenuating circumstances, you must seek approval from your academic adviser. This approval is mandatory for participation in any examinations, including assignments. It is essential to communicate proactively with your adviser to discuss the reasons for any attendance issues and to devise a plan for catching up on missed coursework. Please note that exceptions will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with a strong emphasis on maintaining the integrity of the learning experience for all students.
